name: CNN
text: South Korea's government used hundreds of drones for a spectacular display to thank frontline workers and encourage wearing masks and social distancing. The show was a surprise — officials didn't advertise it ahead of time to avoid crowds. https://t.co/gypb2RGxTe https://t.co/fz7v5T1jOZ

name: CNN
text: Facts First: President Trump can't unilaterally cut current federal funding for schools. However, he could possibly restrict some recent pandemic relief funding and refuse to sign future legislation for federal grants and bailouts for schools. https://t.co/uMdVh2IwjC

name: CNN
text: Pat Chambers, head coach of the men's basketball team at Penn State, apologized Monday for comments he made in 2019 that led to the departure of then-freshman Rasir Bolton https://t.co/dEsGkjNhhe

name: CNN
text: Brooks Brothers, the 200-year-old menswear retailer that has dressed 40 US presidents and unofficially became the outfitter of Wall Street bankers, has filed for bankruptcy https://t.co/TRiODGvTjK https://t.co/s2525T85ih

name: CNN
text:
Corrupt governments around the world are using Covid-19 to crack down on political opposition and curtail human rights. CNN’s Arwa Damon speaks to an LGBT rights lawyer in Uganda, a Filipino activist & a Hungarian journalist.

Watch "Go There" on Facebook: https://t.co/stmLSrtk87 https://t.co/OftAy2jHTS

name: CNN
text: President Trump's event Saturday in New Hampshire could be a test case for the campaign's new approach to rallies. If it works, it could be a sign of what is to come as the team pushes to take advantage of what they view as one of Trump's strongest assets. https://t.co/Gcwj00B5Bb

name: CNN
text: Presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden's campaign has released a raft of policy recommendations crafted by allies of the former vice president and Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont https://t.co/mtXUJTRS7h

name: CNN
text: After George Floyd repeatedly told police that he couldn't breathe, former Minneapolis police Officer Derek Chauvin said, "Then stop talking, stop yelling, it takes a heck of a lot of oxygen to talk," according to transcripts of police body camera footage https://t.co/BjSn3A8kF5

name: CNN
text: Christian Cooper, the Black man who filmed a White woman calling the police on him while he was birdwatching in Central Park in May, has not cooperated with the Manhattan district attorney's investigation, The New York Times reports https://t.co/xpHRYmSayF

name: CNN
text: The city of Tulsa is experiencing a surge in coronavirus cases, a little over 2 weeks after President Trump held a campaign rally in an indoor arena there https://t.co/tJV96Tw7Bm

name: CNN
text:
Twitter may be working on a paid product.

A job listing seeks a senior software engineer in New York to join Gryphon, described as a "new team" that's "building a subscription platform" that can be "reused by other teams in the future." https://t.co/NNKe6HcFOa

name: CNN
text:
Walgreens plans to open full-service doctors' offices in hundreds of its stores across the US during the next five years.

It's part of a bigger effort by the drugstore chain to become a one-stop shop for health care. https://t.co/KHXHbOCwJw

name: CNN
text: "The jarring reality is that Black Americans in DC have not had proper representation in the federal government since the capital's founding," Hakeem Jeffries and Sabeel Rahman write for @CNNOpinion https://t.co/BTRmQshFud

name: CNN
text:
More Americans have been eating at home amid the coronavirus pandemic — and their grocery expenses have been growing.

That's partly because deals normally seen at the grocery store, like two-for-one specials, are getting harder to find. https://t.co/k6X6Pg6OVi
